name: threads-auto-upload-bot
description: Automated Threads (Meta) posting bot with Google Sheets integration and scheduling

scripts.test: node -e "const SheetsClient = require('./src/sheets-client'); const client = new SheetsClient(); client.testConnection().then(() => process.exit(0)).catch(() => process.exit(1))"
scripts.test-sheets: node -e "const SheetsClient = require('./src/sheets-client'); const client = new SheetsClient(); client.testConnection().then(() => process.exit(0)).catch(() => process.exit(1))"
scripts.test-threads: node -e "const ThreadsBot = require('./src/threads-bot'); const bot = new ThreadsBot(); bot.test().then(() => bot.close()).then(() => process.exit(0)).catch(() => process.exit(1))"
scripts.view-threads: node -e "const SheetsClient = require('./src/sheets-client'); const client = new SheetsClient(); client.getThreadData().then(threads => { console.log('ðŸ“‹ Available Threads:'); threads.forEach(t => console.log(`${t.id}. ${t.title} (${t.tweets.length} posts) - ${t.scheduledTime || 'No schedule'}`)); })"
scripts.setup-help: echo 'ðŸ“– Setup Guide:' && echo '1. For Google Sheets: See GOOGLE_SHEETS_SETUP.md' && echo '2. For Threads: Run npm start and choose option 3' && echo '3. Test everything: npm run test'
